start.speaker: Mirka
start.text:
People call cracks ‘omens’ when they don’t want to admit they ignored the load.

If you want me at your side, you don’t get to worship damage. You fix it.

choices.text: Then come with me. We’ll fix what we can.
I’m not sure I can promise that.

end.speaker: Narrator
end.text: Mirka’s hands are scarred the way honest work scars them. If she follows you, it will be to build—never to pretend.
